definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: This dance is accompanied by percussion instruments, including drums and coconut shells.
sentences.chinese: 這種舞蹈要配合鼓和椰子殼類的打擊樂器來表演。

sentences.english: Snare drums and cymbals are traps.
sentences.chinese: 小軍鼓和鈸是打擊樂器。

sentences.english: Suona another is the main, together with a group of percussion instruments.
sentences.chinese: 另一種是以嗩吶爲主，加上一組打擊樂器。

sentences.english: The playing of percussion instrument is one of important ways for children to begin music learning.
sentences.chinese: 錞於是我國古代流行於春秋至漢的一種青銅打擊樂器。

sentences.english: The Chinese percussion instruments are various kinds and they used in wide ranging.
sentences.chinese: 錞於是我國古代流行於春秋至漢的一種青銅打擊樂器。

sentences.english: The first percussion instrument was born.
sentences.chinese: 於是乎，第一個打擊樂器誕生了。

definition: music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
to notate music/to write a score
hulusi, aka cucurbit flute (a kind of free reed wind instrument)
